context: In 2005, ANSYS was a well-established leader in engineering simulation software, providing finite element analysis (FEA), computational fluid dynamics (CFD), and multiphysics simulation tools. The company served industries including aerospace, automotive, electronics, and manufacturing. The simulation software market was competitive with several major players offering overlapping capabilities for virtual product development, structural analysis, and electromagnetic simulation.

competitors.name: Altair Engineering
competitors.notes: Competitor offering CAE software and HyperWorks suite for simulation and optimization across multiple engineering domains

competitors.name: Cadence Design Systems
competitors.notes: Competitor in electronic design automation (EDA) and simulation software for semiconductor and electronics industries

competitors.name: Dassault Syst√®mes
competitors.notes: Major competitor providing simulation through SIMULIA brand, integrated with broader PLM and 3D design platforms

competitors.name: Autodesk
competitors.notes: Competitor in CAD and engineering design software with simulation and analysis capabilities

competitors.name: MSC Software
competitors.notes: Direct competitor in finite element analysis and multidisciplinary simulation for product development

competitors.name: COMSOL
competitors.notes: Competitor offering multiphysics simulation software for modeling and analysis across engineering disciplines
